text: Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing.
And whoever puts their trust in Allah, He is sufficient for them.
And do not consume one another’s wealth unjustly.
Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear.
Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
So remember Me; I will remember you.
And speak to people good words.
Whoever does an atom’s weight of good will see it.
And whoever fears Allah, He will make for him a way out.
And whoever relies upon Allah, then indeed, He will suffice him.
And be patient, for indeed, Allah is with the patient.
Do not despair of the mercy of Allah.
Indeed, the prayer is a duty on the believers at appointed times.
And say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge.
And seek help through patience and prayer.
Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
And cooperate in righteousness and piety.
Verily, in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest.
He created death and life to test you as to which of you is best in deed.
Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge.
And lower your wing of humility to the believers.
And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
And whoever does evil or wrongs themselves, then seeks forgiveness of Allah, will find Allah Forgiving, Merciful.
And whoever gives life to one soul, it is as if he has saved all mankind.
And your Lord is Forgiving, Full of Mercy.
Indeed, Allah commands justice, kindness, and giving to relatives.
And do not walk on the earth with arrogance.
And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden except by right.
And whoever is grateful, his gratitude is only for himself.
Good and evil are not equal. Repel evil with what is better.
And when My servants ask you concerning Me, indeed I am near.
And do not waste, for Allah does not love the wasteful.
Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who do good.
And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided.
O mankind, indeed We created you from male and female and made you into nations and tribes so you may know one another.
And speak the truth, even if it is against yourselves.
And do not spy or backbite one another.
And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for his own benefit.
And the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.
